channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2024040068
item.description:
Report E-2024040068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a punctured box containing (4) 1-gallon jugs of Instant Power Main Line Cleaner that were punctured as a result of dunnage. This resulted in 1-gallon release of product onto itâ€™s outer cardboard box and the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor neutralized the release with vinegar and generated one drum of waste for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024040081
item.description:
Report X-2024040081

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WENT DO DOOR 18 IN THE UNLOAD. CLEANED UP SPILL USING CLAY ABSORBENT AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA AND PROCESSED USING ZEP ZORBENT WHILE WEARING GOOGLES, GLOVES, BOOTS AND APRON. RTS THE SLAVABLE SHIPMENT VIA YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024031432
item.description:
Report X-2024031432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: FORT WALTON BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS BEING RE-PACKED DUE TO LEAKAGE ONTO THE PACKAGE NOT FROM THE CONTENTS. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTAINED UNDECLARED HAZMAT MATERIAL. THE OUTER PACKAGE HAD NOT IDENTIFYING MARKS/LABELS AND THERE WERE NO SHIPPING/HAZMAT DOCUMENTS INCLUDED WITH THE PACCKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2024030608
item.description:
Report E-2024030608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 26650
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit struck a pole at the customer location causing damage to the unloading/loading line on the trailer. Approximately 40 gallons of gasoline was released and a small amount was able to impact a nearby storm drain. Hull's Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024030590
item.description:
Report E-2024030590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 cup of acetone (UN1090) released from 2 5 gal metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 30 gallon DF containing 2 pails with product was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
